alert.note: Alert for Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 11:38PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hart, northwestern Laurens, southeastern Greenville, Anderson, southeastern Pickens, northern Abbeville and southeastern Oconee Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1137 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Anderson, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Anderson, Easley, Clemson, Laurens, Hartwell, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Mauldin and Simpsonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
